Sentencas: Solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) show potential applications in CO2 utilization and renewable energy resources storage due to their fast kinetics and high energy efficiency.
Titulo: In situ Construction of Metal/Perovskite Interfaces with Exsolved FeNi Alloy Nanoparticles for High-Temperature CO2 Electrolysis

Sentencas: However, the absence of active and stable electrode materials has limited the practical applications of SOECs for CO2 electrolysis.
Titulo: In situ Construction of Metal/Perovskite Interfaces with Exsolved FeNi Alloy Nanoparticles for High-Temperature CO2 Electrolysis

Sentencas: Herein, FeNi alloy nanoparticles anchored on a La0.6Sr0.4Fe0.85Ni0.05Nb0.1O3-delta (LSFNN) perovskite surface were developed by controlling appropriate in situ exsolution conditions for CO2 electrolysis.
Titulo: In situ Construction of Metal/Perovskite Interfaces with Exsolved FeNi Alloy Nanoparticles for High-Temperature CO2 Electrolysis

Sentencas: The FeNi@LSFNN-based SOEC showed current densities of 0.57
Titulo: In situ Construction of Metal/Perovskite Interfaces with Exsolved FeNi Alloy Nanoparticles for High-Temperature CO2 Electrolysis

Sentencas: A cm-2 at 700 degrees C and 1.16 A cm-2 at 800 degrees C at 1.6 V, which are 1.39 and 1.18 times those of the pristine LSFNN-based cell, respectively.
Titulo: In situ Construction of Metal/Perovskite Interfaces with Exsolved FeNi Alloy Nanoparticles for High-Temperature CO2 Electrolysis

Sentencas: The distribution of relaxation time analysis of electrochemical impedance spectra and CO2 temperature-programmed desorption results indicate that the in situ constructed FeNi@LSFNN interfaces with abundant oxygen vacancies promote the adsorption, activation, and dissociation of CO2 molecules, thus improving the CO2 electrolysis performance of SOECs.
Titulo: In situ Construction of Metal/Perovskite Interfaces with Exsolved FeNi Alloy Nanoparticles for High-Temperature CO2 Electrolysis
